Package sample.Controller

Class CurrentOrderController

java.lang.Object
sample.Controller.CurrentOrderController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class CurrentOrderController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
CurrentOrder controller links the CurrentOrder View to the CurrentOrder Model. It updates the sub total, sales tax, and total price upon adding/removing menu items. In addition, you can add the current orders to a stored order list.

    • getCurrentOrder

      public static Order getCurrentOrder()
      Getter for the Current Order object to add the menu items.
      Returns:
      Order object which represents the current order

    • checkEmptyOrder

      public boolean checkEmptyOrder()
      Checks if the current order has no menu items in it. If so, it will generate a popup warning to notify the user that they need to add some menu items. It will also disable the Place Order and Remove Item buttons.
      Returns:
      true if empty, otherwise false

    • disableButtons

      private void disableButtons()
      Disables the place order and remove item buttons.

    • generateEmptyWarning

      private void generateEmptyWarning()
      Generates the alert message for an empty cart (current order has no menu items).

    • updateItems

      public void updateItems()
      Updates the menu items list view with all the menu items currently added to the cart.

    • updateCosts

      public void updateCosts()
      Performs the necessary menu item calculations for each menu item and updates the sub total, sales tax, and total price of all menu items rounded to the nearest hundredths place.

    • handleRemoveItem

      public void handleRemoveItem()
      Handles the removal of a selected item in the menu item listview. Updates the current order object and the sub total, sales tax, and total price and the menu item listview. If no item was selected, it will display a warning alert that tells the user to select an item from the menu item list view. If the user removes the last item in the list view, it will display a warning and disable the buttons.

    • addToStoredOrders

      public void addToStoredOrders()
      Handles the adding to the stored orders. If there are no items currently in the current order, it will not add it to the stored orders and just display a warning instead and disables the buttons. Upon addition of the current order to the stored orders, it will generate a new order object and update the sub total, sales, and total price and the list view and disable all the buttons and display a alert indicating it has successfully added the current order to the stored orders.
